subtitle: Hello and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. I imagine
that by now many of you already realize that
in conjunction with White Crow Books we've just
launched the new Thinking Allowed Dialogues
book imprint, and our first title is, Is There Life After Death?
Thinking Allowed. Conversations on the leading
edge of knowledge and discovery with psychologist
Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. Our
topic today is researching bioenergy, or subtle
energy. My guest is Wagner Allegretti, who is
one of the co-founders with Nancy Trevillato
of the International Academy of Consciousness.
They have a beautiful campus located in Portugal.
Wagner is originally from Brazil. He is
also author of a book called Retrocognition,
and he has conducted extensive research that
we'll be talking about today. Welcome, Wagner.
Thank you. Thank you for having me. It's a pleasure to be here.
It is a pleasure and an honor for me to be with
you. You showed me some of your research findings
yesterday. They're really quite extraordinary
and we'll be sharing them today with our viewers,
but let's begin with how you define bioenergy.
Well, I think this is one of the hardest things
to do to define bioenergy, but I think we can start
with some synonyms, other expressions people use
for that. So throughout time, people have called
this chi, argon, many times subtle energy, life
force, animal magnetism. In fact, there are more than 100 different synonyms for that.
People have this idea of a kind of a life field, a life force, something that gives
life to the physical body. But also I see
that, let us call bioenergy from this point on,
as a domain tool for the consciousness. If we
think of consciousness as something beyond the
brain, body, matter, energy, time, it's very
difficult for us to think how consciousness
would interact with the physical body, with the
physical brain. It seems this sort of life field,
this bioenergy, would be the bridge, the interface
between the consciousness and the physical body.
But many people have heard about bioenergy in phenomena like healing, or poltergeist,
PK, telekinesis, and things like that. But I
think this goes much beyond that, because I think
bioenergy is in fact a very important key, a
part in the nature or the structure of reality.
Well, I gather one of the key ingredients of this particular form of bioenergy of
most interest to you is that it can be directed through conscious intention.
Exactly. So all life or life forms, living
things, they are alive because of this bioenergy.
But this bioenergy so works, is being absorbed,
transformed, applied in a kind of unconscious way.
So it's a natural process that goes by itself.
So we are alive here, in part, because we are
absorbing, transforming, and even emitting this
form of energy. But it's possible for us to be
aware of this energy, to sense it, and to control
it. So to simplify, we can train ourselves to
acquire these two basic abilities, to sense, to
feel energy, and to control it. Some people are
born with this kind of sensitivity. Some people
can apply energy even if they don't have too much
control of that. But throughout the years, in so
many decades working with this, we have noticed
that some people, they are born with this kind of
ability, but others never felt this. And in fact,
this is my case. I started having my Autobot
experiences when I was young, about nine years
old. I used to have this that is called vibrational
state. I could feel this very powerful vibration
inside of my body. It was already a manifestation
of this form of energy, but I didn't know how to
provoke, to control that. Throughout the years,
you know, with contact with so many people reading,
meeting healers, mediums, little by little, I
learned that we can control this. So nowadays,
I can feel energy, many times from people,
different places, trees, sometimes even in my sight
scenes. When I go in tourism, I already apply this
kind of enrichment of my experience, because you
can feel the energy of different places. But then,
when we learn how to really control this energy,
you can help other people, you can cleanse the
energies of a particular place. And even more,
you can have a better degree of control of your
Autobot experiences, because it seems this subtle
body that we have, some people like to call it
the astral body, the psychosoma, and so many other
different names, is glued to the physical body
through this kind of field. So think of that as
a kind of magnetic field that keeps the astral
body inside of the physical body. The purpose of
this energy body that we have is really to sustain
life. But if we learn how to control this energy
body, we learn how to detach the psychosoma from
the body. And vibrational state is one of the ways
for that. But also, for instance, in terms of our
health, if we absorb more energy, we can improve
our health, we can have more vitality. So sometimes
when I feel I have a little bit of an illness,
could be a flu or a cold, if I absorb more natural
energy, I can expedite the whole process of,
you know, the healing, the recovery of the
physical body. Well, I suppose it's important
to clarify for our viewers, since you use the
term magnetic, we're not really talking about
electromagnetism. Exactly, we are not. So this is
a different form of energy. In fact, I think it is
good for us to clarify this. We use the word energy
just to simplify the whole thing, because this kind
of factor in life sometimes manifests more like
a force, sometimes like a fluid, many times
as energy because it can produce some work, but
many times it's more like information. So I think
what we call bioenergy, in fact, is a different
kind of physical or para-physical entity in this
world, because this form of energy can carry
information with it, information in many cases
that comes from us. So that's why many times
people say, oh, the vibes in that place were
really good. Oh, the vibes in that other situation
were really bad. So what we say is good energy or
bad energy, in fact, relates more to the information
that is there. Like, for instance, some spaces,
places, they can have a kind of a memory of things
that happened there, being good or bad. Sometimes
we get close to some people and we feel that
person communicates a kind of a field of something
pleasant. It makes you feel more alive. It settles
your emotions. But sometimes it's the opposite.
Sometimes when we get close to some people, they
make us much worse than we were before. So it's
important for us to know, for instance, how to
defend ourselves from this kind of energy contagion,
for instance. And I guess it's also fair to say
that aside from the work of a few people such
as yourself, this form of energy isn't really
recognized by science yet. Certainly not, because
we lack technology to measure, to detect this. And
the example used to use in these discussions is
like electricity. We have always had electricity
in nature in ourselves throughout the whole
existence of us. But only more recently is when
we could start measuring, detecting, noticing
manifestations, effects of electricity. And then we developed means, devices to measure
electricity. So we are at this transition now.
Bioenergy is part of nature, but we still don't
have reliable ways of measuring that. That's
exactly where I want to work and to see if I
can make a difference there. Now you began by telling me that as a child, I think you
said nine years old, you had out-of-body
experiences. You grew up in Brazil, a country
which, in my experience, Brazilians are very open by and large to these things.
Spiritualism is rampant in Brazil. And you became, prior to your present
phase of work with the International Academy
of Consciousness, you were involved with a very
prominent Brazilian spiritual teacher and researcher,
Waldo Vieira, who was a spiritualist medium.
Exactly, exactly. Before him, I was being part of
many different spiritualistic groups in Brazil,
yoga, sama, eastern tradition. So I was really
trying to pursue to find any kind of information
that could help me to understand what was going
on with me. Then in 1982, I met Waldo Vieira.
I was at the beginning of my university there.
And what was interesting is that I noticed that
Waldo was having a more technical, scientific
approach to that. That attracted my attention.
And I worked with him for many years until we
split because of some difference of positions,
you know, more like political ones on this. But
then certainly the base of that is the same. So
like the consciousness being multidimensional,
you know, we are more than the physical body.
And what is important to say that I think it is
useful for a lot of people is that a lot of people
still think that you have to be born with these
abilities, otherwise you wouldn't have the chance
of having these experiences. And it is not exactly
like that. It's like asking if everybody can play
piano. Well, perhaps some people are going to have
more talent, perhaps with a few lessons the person
is going to be there playing like, you know, a
composer there. Other people might need more time,
but it's exactly the same thing with us. If we
get information, if we apply our time, our effort
in practicing, all of us can learn how to live the
body, how to control energy. But also I think it's
important that the understanding of this can really
help us to go deeper on this kind of practice.
Otherwise we get too much on the surface of it.
That's exactly my thing because I have always
been the kind of, you know, technical guy,
dismantling everything and anything at home,
inventing things, you know, creating short circuits
in my home to the despair of my mother there.
And I got into university to study electrical
engineering. And I always thought there was,
there had to be a way of putting that kind of
reality of my out of our experience, the lucid
dreams and the technical engineering physics part
together. Because many times people see these two
things as being incompatible, separate, but the
universe is one. So these are just manifestations
of the human mind trying to understand reality.
And I think they can be put together there. So
throughout these years leaving the body, for
instance, many times I saw in other realities,
in other dimensions, technology, devices that
were working or used this form of bioenergy,
things that we still don't have here. So in some
particular level of reality, you see a kind of
technology that is a lot more advanced than the
one we have here. So it's up to us now to see if
we can invent, discover that. I think everything
starts with the concept of a transducer, something
that can transform one form of energy into another one. It's like the microphone here.
It gets the mechanical vibration of our voice
and translates that into electricity or variation
of some electrical properties there. And then you
can amplify this, you can record. And we have also
the speakers. They do the opposite. So you get
electricity there, no changing, and you get sound.
So we have to discover a transducer for the
bioenergy. Can we get a device that would get
bioenergy and then can translate this into electricity or changes in the electricity?
And perhaps the opposite? And then certainly
we can create a whole technology based on that.
Well, since you brought up the analogy of the microphone and the loudspeaker,
reminded me that the man who invented the loudspeaker, among many other inventions,
was Sir Oliver Lodge, who was a great researcher
into spiritualism and this whole area. There are
always these fascinating connections like that.
Let's now talk about the actual experimental
research you've engaged in. Yes. So I think it was
when I started studying at university, I thought,
look, can some of these sensitive devices that
are used by scientists in labs, can they detect
this form of bioenergy? So then with my access
to some labs in the university, I tried to see
if I could affect some magnetometers, Geiger
counters, some very sensitive semiconductor
transducers for electrical things. Well, to my
power of energy, I could not create any change
and any result with that. And I devised many
different properties there or devices using
those properties, no result. And then I got back
and thought, look, life is already the natural
transducer to bioenergy. The body is really transmutating or changing this bioenergy in
this physical expression that we have here. But
I didn't want to use living things. I didn't want
to put wires in plants or in animals because of
ethical concerns, of course, but also because you
cannot rely on those things as being stable
enough because the life itself is so dynamic.
Some living things, they have their own behavior.
So we would never know if those results would be
result of our own bioenergy or the internal processes of those things there. But then I
thought, well, what are the basic building blocks of life? Some form of carbohydrates,
these or that, but mostly protein. Proteins are
a class of substance. They are so dynamic, so
variety. They can be building blocks for the
construction of the body, but they can be
catalysts, enzymes to some chemical reactions.
And I thought, look, let me try to use a
common form of protein like collagen that is
very easy for us because it's basically the
gelatin that we eat. So I get pharmaceutical-grade
collagen. I made some gels there and I put some
electrodes inside of the gel in a kind of a disk
like this. And I measured some of the electrical
characteristics of that. Basically, at first
it was just the electrical resistance of that,
something easy for us to measure with any cheap
instrument. And then I start submitting that to
bioenergy with myself, some healers, some other
people. And sometimes, not every time, I noticed
a variation of the electrical resistance there.
So I think that my hypothesis was right. So our
energy field can change something, the proteins,
perhaps the shape of it, because the 3D
structure of the protein is very important for
so many reactions we have in our physical body,
for instance. Perhaps these chains, they would
also change the electrical conductivity of those
proteins there. And then for a long while I had to
stop that because of giving classes and traveling.
But more recently, the last 10 years, I thought
of using functional MRI because I wanted to know
what changes in the brain when we work with
energy because the neuron, I think, is the best
transducer we have. So when I do something like
this, it's me as a consciousness, not as the body,
controlling the brain to create this. There
has to be something, especially in the neuron,
that receives this bioenergy information and
translates into electricity or, you know,
changes in our chemistry here. So with some contacts, connections, friends, I got the
opportunity to work with some of these, you know,
MRI machines. But instead of using them just to get
an anatomical view of the body, a static, like
an x-ray, you know, in a way, if you will,
to get information about the structure of the
body, there is this variant, the functional MRI,
that shows which areas of the brain are more
active as we engage into some particular
behavior. So you can make some mental calculation,
you can try to remember something that was very
emotional to you, you can meditate, and then this
technique will show which areas of the brain are
more active there. And then I thought, what would happen when we try to absorb energy,
when we create the vibrational state? So I ran many, many, many experiments like that,
and then I noticed then when I got into the
vibrational state, that is something that I can
produce at will, many areas of the brain, they
lit up. Not only a particular area, but the whole
brain. And sometimes the instrument there, the
machine, showed lights or the signal, per se,
the bold signal, as it is called, out of my skull. And this shouldn't happen at all.
Well, let's talk for a moment about how the MRI
works. Magnetic resonance imagery is MRI. So it's
got to detect something that responds to magnetic
fluctuations in the body or in the brain if you're
imaging your head, which would be the hemoglobin,
the hemoglobin in the blood. So what you're really
looking at is increases or decreases of blood
flow in different areas of the brain. So if you're
showing a response outside of your head completely, and we can show our viewers the
images of this, certainly there's no hemoglobin
splattering around outside your head.
Exactly. So as you can imagine, when I showed this
to radiologists, medical doctors, and physicists,
some of them said, or most of them said, there
was a mistake here. This is a fluke. This is an
artifact. There was some problem with acquisition
of image. Perhaps you moved your head as you were
doing these experiments. I said, I guarantee I
didn't move my head. I tried this so many times.
And I said, look, if I, when I was there inside
of the machine, just relaxed, these things didn't
happen. But as I engaged in my internal thinking,
using my will to move energy, these things appeared.
But then, as you can imagine, I tried to isolate
all these factors, but I tried, for instance,
a bottle of water that is the ghost or the phantom of the function MRI. They use this
just as a very simple thing to calibrate the
machine. They put this bottle there inside of
the machine instead of the head of the person,
and then they can adjust the sensitivity, gain,
and so many different things to know everything
is working right. And in one of my experiments,
I put that bottle there, and we ran many sequences
showing that everything was there behaving as
it should be. But then, when I was emitting energy to that bottle, some light, the bold
signal appeared inside of the bottle of water
there. So this couldn't be the bottle moving.
This couldn't be just the bottle getting anxious
or creating too much of an expectation. As they
told, it could be the case with the brain, with
a person there. After some time, I thought of
using something more organic instead of being
just water, putting a chicken egg there inside.
And I still consider this to be the best result so
far. So I ran many sequences with the egg there.
Egg in the bottle? Is that how it works?
No, no, just egg. I took the bottle out inside
of that kind of the cage there that goes around
of our head. I put just the egg there, sitting
there by itself. So as you run the function MRI
there, first a normal MRI just to get the structure there. You can see the yolk,
you can see the internal structure, but nothing special there, no bold signal.
And then I did a sequence like this, about a
minute without doing anything, another minute
with me sending, transmitting energy, like if I
were healing the egg, and another minute without
doing anything. So what happened there? So during
this first minute, the machine is working there
with all that noise and the images there, just
gray without anything. I was inside of the room
of the function MRI there, behind the machine,
but not inside of that big coil, exactly to avoid
any kind of interference, because somebody could
say that my hands moved, altered the magnetic
field in some way. So I was very careful with that.
But then when I got the instruction, and we can
hear this in the video, start. So then I start
pumping, no sending energy, not with the physical
movement, just mentally. And then after a few
seconds, because all the computing effect imposed
a kind of delay of five, six seconds there.
And then you start seeing this glow of light,
it's just a representation of the natural magnetic
resonance of the protons there inside of that egg
changing. Because this machine creates a big,
powerful magnetic field with all the protons
pointing in the same direction. And then the
machine pumps some extra electromagnetic energy
there to see if they can deviate that for a
while, how long it takes to come back to that.
So this is the magnetic resonance. So in some
way, this that we call bioenergy changes this
behavior. So this is a quantum effect. This is
the spin of the protons there. This is not a
microscopic behavior like changing temperature or
pressure. It's something there really at the core
of the structure of matter. But then returning
to the description of experiment, all this
bold signal gets stronger and stronger. And
then after about a minute, my friend tells me,
stop. And then without any movement, staying
exactly the same position, I stop pumping energy.
After a few seconds, you can see the bold signal
reducing until it disappears. So certainly,
we need more people repeating this kind of experiment to be sure this is a kind of
universal phenomenon happens to different
people in different machines, different places.
But I repeated this many times, getting the same
result. So this shows to me that we can change
some kind of internal intrinsic property of matter
there. Certainly, this is nothing new to us because
I have seen cases of poltergeist, things moving,
things catching fire spontaneously. So I didn't
need that to prove this reality to me. That was not
the point. But I wanted to see if I could devise
a kind of experiment that would help other people,
skeptical people, to see something that can be
repeated, can be controlled, that would show
really the human mind, the intention, can drive
some form of energy or field that can change the structure of matter.
There have been many experiments in
psychokinesis affecting the widest variety of
instrumentation, often random event generators,
quantum mechanical random event generators
seem to be particularly sensitive. Is there in your
mind a distinction between psychokinesis and the
conscious movement of bioenergy? No, I think
they are basically essentially the same.
What happens many times with some people is that
they don't feel the energy they are pumping out.
They feel only the intention of doing something.
But I think it is the same thing. Something,
a field, if you will, centered on that particular
consciousness, affects the whole universe,
to which extent we don't know. Many times we
have the combination of many different people,
many different consciousnesses, aligning to
a very particular purpose. So I have read of
experiments in which people could change, for
instance, the pattern of crystallization of
some substances, the surface tension of water,
some magnetic effects, and movements, of course,
you know, sometimes even in an isolated chamber.
But I think this energy can change many different
properties of matter. But then perhaps some of
them would require a big power amount of energy.
To move something requires a lot of energy. So
perhaps this is not something that everybody
would be able to do. What I'm trying to see is
if I can get, if we can devise a way to measure
bioenergy, even if it is not that intense, to get
more sensitivity to that particular device in a
way that would work with everyone, anyone. The way
I see, we will have in the future something like
the tricorder of Star Trek, that we can go around
and measure the bioenergy of a particular place,
a tree, you know, a cat. Even to use for medicine,
can we measure the overall vitality of someone?
Even if that person is not intentionally pumping
energy there, because our whole planet, life,
and people, they combine there, they overlap their own fields of energy there.
Well, you've trained, I'm guessing, thousands of
people in both out-of-body experience and in the
uses of the bioenergy, the conscious working with
the bioenergy. Have your students been able to
do some of these things? Oh yes, yes, yes. And
even some of them were part of some of these
experiments that I have done. But at least to
their, you know, the way they relate or they report,
they say that they were able many times to
help someone, to take away the pain of someone,
to help their plants or even pets. Many times
people have some health problems or some challenges
and working with energy, they could overcome that.
Many times, for instance, pain, many times with
the difficulty to fall asleep, even many times
with psychological challenges, anxiety, depression.
It is interesting how these things can be so
effective. It's a pity that our medicine is still,
no, it's so skeptical about these things, because there is basically no risk.
The worst that could happen for a person is to
quiet down, to close the eyes, and to relax for
a bit. But anyway, we can achieve a lot more than
just that. And as I said before, a lot of people
who were not sensitive to energy, they had never
heard about it. After some training, learning,
they can develop their own abilities. Usually
most of the people feel first the ability to sense
energy. After a while, they can really control
that. So with time, you can control the intensity
of the energy you can project. You can control the
rhythm. You can control the kind of information
you try to transfer to someone. Because suppose
if someone is very depressed, and then when we
emit energy, we want to see if we can give more
motivation, more optimism to that person, if you
can drive the person to be more vitalized. But if
someone is already very agitated, very anxious,
perhaps we should do the opposite. It's calming the
person, quieting down. So the kind of information
we put in the energy is very, very important
there. But in my experiments, I think we are
still far from this point of detecting the information in the energy. Now, up to this
moment is being more like a quantitative
analysis, how much energy we are pumping there.
But the way I see is in the future, we are going
to have a way of measuring this energy, not only
detecting if it is there or not, but having a
proportional measure of the power of the energy.
And I think we will be able to give it a kind of unit for measurement, like
you know, volts, like lumens. So we will be able to create this, to have a scale.
So then we will be able to really do more research
on that, when we can attribute, give numbers
to this reality. Well, I'm pretty sure, even
though medicine and science has a very hard time
dealing with this energy, because although your
experiments with the FMRI seem quite impressive,
for the most part, scientists don't know about this. It's not as if you've been
published in the Journal of Physics or something. But in martial arts traditions,
in yoga traditions, in acupuncture traditions,
in many healing traditions, there are,
I guess I would call them lineages or lore of one
kind or another, sometimes going back hundreds,
thousands of years. People have been working with
this energy regardless of what the scientists
say. Absolutely, absolutely. And it is interesting
that this is, as you said, very ancient,
has been part of the human culture for so long. But for a long while there was a big,
how could I say, deep reaction, like a kind
of denial of this. So perhaps now we can feel,
see this more as a common thing. But it's not
only with medicine, but for instance, in physics.
By the way, it's interesting that when I show the
results of my research to many different people,
the physicists are most of the time more open
to this than the medical doctors. They have a
more open mind to this. And even I went to a
course in Brazil many years ago for a kind of
specialization in function MRI. So I was in a
university with very knowledgeable people in
this area with teachers, professors from different
areas there. Those guys, when they saw my results,
they got very impressed by that. They didn't
think it was just because of some fluke,
the acquisition of information that was just
kind of no artifact, as they say. So when you
really talk to people who understand deeply the
process there, they get really curious about that.
So we should go further on that. I had to stop
this for a while because of the COVID problem.
Nobody could leave their homes. They could not
travel. But now I intended to get back to that.
I have an opportunity probably in Paris, in France, to get another machine there to run
more experiments. And I will try to narrow this to
a much specific kind of experiment because I was
trying something very broad. I was using the water
and the egg and my brain, other people there,
because it was being more like exploratory to
see my way around. But now I think we can go
much further there. But there is something that
I didn't put there in that TEDx presentation that
I showed you. In one of these experiments, I put
a friend inside of the machine instead of the egg,
and I asked him just to relax and wait. Without
telling him there, while the machine was working,
during one particular moment there, like the
egg, I start transmitting energies to his head
without his previous knowledge of that. The same
effect that happened in the egg happened there.
Nothing the first. Third, when I sent energy
there, a lot of lights in many parts of his brain.
When I stopped, this influence reduced again. And
he's inside the MRI machine. They're very noisy.
They're very noisy, very claustrophobic. So
in some of these experiments, these sessions,
I had to stay inside of these machines for hours.
My record, I think, was three hours and a half,
session after session after session. Because
once you move, once you get out of the machine,
you have to run the first steps of the procedure, the protocol there. Again,
it can take a long time to get the image of the
brain and so on. But anyway, oh, in the name of
science. Well, you're a pioneer. You're looking
at areas of energy that many scientists think
cannot possibly exist. They don't even know they don't know.
But not only do you research it, you train people to work with this energy. I've had a
conversation with Nancy Trevalato who has demonstrated enormous subtlety in her
understanding of all of the nuances of how we
work with energy. Most people don't even have
the words to describe this. It's true. So that's
why many times we are forced to create new words.
And once we start feeling energy, and we see this in our training with our students,
at the beginning we are very, how could I say,
imprecise, very coarse with our perceptions.
We sense a bit, but then we don't. But little by little, it's like our palate,
it's like our ability to smell things. A lot
of people can, for instance, drink, let me say,
coffee, and they can say, oh, this is Arabic,
or this is Robusta, and this is from Ethiopia,
this is from Colombia, this is from Highland,
whatever. I can only say if it is good or not.
Official tasters.
Exactly. So you see how much people can practice to be able to distinguish nuances.
And the resolution of the differences of
sensations get higher and higher with training.
We follow exactly the same idea with energy. So
in our training, for instance, we try to show
people, look, try to feel energy from the earth, from the geological formations here.
And we train people to see if they can give
names to that. Oh, this energy is like warmer,
it's like thick, it moves like molasses. So
analogies at the beginning. And then we tell people,
try to feel energy from the air, from the atmosphere. And then what do you feel? Oh,
this energy is more like sparky, it's faster, it's colder. Again, it's like kids,
you know, trying to describe something, but we
get better and better. And then we tell them,
try to feel energy from the trees, from water. So by contrasting, comparing,
people get better and better. It's like, for instance, we were talking about coffee,
how some of these connoisseurs got there to that
point, tasting and drinking a lot of coffees from
many different sources. So if we try no different
coffees from many different coffee beans,
different points of roasting them, we can compare,
